alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Crawford; Dooly; Harris; Houston; Macon; Marion; Muscogee; Peach; Schley; Talbot; Taylor (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 7:12AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Macon, northern Marion, Muscogee, northeastern Dooly, northern Chattahoochee, Peach, southern Houston, south central Crawford, northwestern Schley, southern Talbot, Taylor and southern Harris Counties through 745 AM EDT... At 711 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Saint Louis to Columbus Metropolitan Airport, and moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Perry, Fort Valley, Buena Vista, Butler, Oglethorpe, Talbotton, Unadilla, Montezuma, Marshallville, Reynolds, Waverly Hall, Ideal, Junction City, Geneva, North Fort Moore, Bibb City, Upatoi, Brantley and Hayneville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Chattahoochee; Crawford; Dooly; Harris; Houston; Macon; Marion; Muscogee; Peach; Schley; Talbot; Taylor
